entry.title: New release for Linkwarden: v2.8.4
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • fixed placeholder in german translation by @clemenstyp in https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/pull/867
  • fix(monolith): quote url by @keizie in https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/pull/896
  • 2.8.3 french translation by @Go-rom in https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/pull/885
  • Dev by @daniel31x13 in https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/pull/898
  • minor fix by @daniel31x13 in https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/pull/899

New Contributors

  • @clemenstyp made their first contribution in https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/pull/867
  • @keizie made their first contribution in https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/pull/896
  • @Go-rom made their first contribution in https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/pull/885

Full Changelog: https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/compare/v2.8.3...v2.8.4

entry.title: New release for Linkwarden: v2.9.0
entry.content:
Announcing Linkwarden 2.9

Happy New Year! üéâ We're excited to announce the release of Linkwarden 2.9! ü•≥ This update brings significant improvements and new features to enhance your experience.

For those who are new to Linkwarden, it's basically a tool for saving and organizing your bookmarks, articles, and documents in one place. You can also share your links with others, create public collections, and collaborate with your team. Linkwarden is available as a Cloud subscription or you can self-host it on your own server.

As always before we start, we'd like to express our sincere thanks to all of our Cloud subscription users. Your support is crucial to our growth and allows us to continue improving. Thank you for being such an important part of our journey. üöÄ

[!TIP] We're actively bringing new features to Linkwarden users around the globe. If you like our work, please Star our repo on GitHub! ‚≠êÔ∏è Your support means a lot to us.

What‚Äôs new:

‚ú® Local AI Tagging (Optional)

We've added a new feature that automatically tags your links based on their content. This feature uses a local AI model to analyze the content of your links and can assign tags to links in 2 ways:

  1. Auto-generate Tags: When a link is added, Linkwarden will automatically generate and assign tags based on the content of the link.
  2. Using Predefined Tags: You can also use predefined tags to let Linkwarden auto-assign tags based on the content of the link.

You can enable this feature in the Settings > Preferences page. If you're self-hosting Linkwarden, please refer to the documentation for more information on how to set up and use this feature.

üé® Customizable Theme

We've added a new feature that allows you to customize the theme of your Linkwarden account. You can now choose from a set of predefined colors.

üì∏ Capture articles directly from browser extension

Sometimes certain websites prevent bots from accessing their content. In such cases, you can now capture the article directly from your browser using the Linkwarden browser extension and upload it to Linkwarden. Get it from the Chrome Web Store or Firefox Add-ons.

Also please give us a 5-star rating if you like it :D

üìã View the Preserved Formats on Links

Each link now shows the available preserved formats. This allows you to easily see the preserved formats for the link and open the link in the desired format in a new tab.

‚¨áÔ∏è Import from Omnivore

We've added a new import option to allow you to import your links from Omnivore. You can now easily migrate your links from Omnivore to Linkwarden.

üåü RSS feed for Public Collections

Public collections now have an RSS feed link which lets others to follow your public collections and receive updates when you add new links.

üîî Subscribe to RSS feed

Linkwarden now supports subscribing to RSS feeds. You can subscribe to any RSS feed and Linkwarden will automatically fetch and save new items from the feed.

‚öôÔ∏è Choose what's shown on the Dashboard

You can now choose to show/hide your pinned links and recent links sections on the dashboard. This allows you to customize the dashboard to your liking.

üåê Added More Translations

Thanks to the collaborators, we've added Polish and Russian translations to Linkwarden. If you'd like to help us translate Linkwarden into your language, check out #216.

‚úÖ And more...

Check out the full changelog below.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/compare/v2.8.4...v2.9.0

entry.title: New release for Linkwarden: v2.9.1
entry.content:
This release enables Docker users to take advantage of the NEXT_PUBLIC_ environment variables, which fixes most of the SMTP/SSO/AI issues...

Full Changelog: https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/compare/v2.9.0...v2.9.1

entry.title: New release for Linkwarden: v2.9.2
entry.content:
Fixed a bug where the User Administration page would show some error for some users.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/linkwarden/linkwarden/compare/v2.9.1...v2.9.2
